p: Among the 17 bacteremia patients, five (29.4%) patients had bacteremia ( Staphylococcus aureus in 3, Pseudomonas aeruginosa in one, and Actinomyces oris and Streptococcus salivarius in one) within 48 h after hospitalization. Twelve patients experienced bacteremia after 48 h admission including Staphylococcus aureus ( n = 3), Enterococcus species ( n = 3), Stenotrophomonas maltophilia ( n = 2), viridans streptococcus ( n = 1), and Acinetobacter pittii ( n = 1). Staphylococcus aureus (35.3%) (16.7% were methicillin resistant) and Enterococcus species (17.6%) were the most frequently isolated bacteria from blood cultures.
